faq.question: What is the difference between Cloudflare Workers and AWS Lambda?
faq.answer: Cloudflare Workers use V8 isolates that start in under 5ms (vs Lambda's 500ms-10s cold starts), bill only for CPU time (not wall clock time), and run in 330+ cities globally rather than specific AWS regions. This results in up to 80% cost reduction and significantly better global latency.

faq.question: How much can Cloudflare Workers reduce cloud costs?
faq.answer: Companies like Baselime have reported 80-95% cost reductions when migrating from AWS to Cloudflare Workers, primarily because Workers charge only for CPU time rather than the time code spends waiting on databases, APIs, or AI models.

faq.question: What are V8 isolates in Cloudflare Workers?
faq.answer: V8 isolates are lightweight sandboxes using the same JavaScript engine that powers Chrome. They start in under 5ms with about 3MB memory overhead, compared to 35MB for a basic Node.js Lambda. A single V8 process can run thousands of isolates concurrently.

faq.question: What services are included in the Cloudflare Workers platform?
faq.answer: Cloudflare Workers platform includes: D1 (SQLite database at the edge), R2 (S3-compatible storage with zero egress fees), Durable Objects (strongly-consistent coordination), Workers AI (20+ ML models), Queues (event-driven messaging), and KV Storage (key-value store with global distribution).

faq.question: When should I NOT use Cloudflare Workers?
faq.answer: Cloudflare Workers may not be ideal for: heavy CPU-bound batch processing (video encoding), applications requiring specific language runtimes (legacy Java, .NET), workloads deeply integrated with AWS-specific services, applications needing more than 128MB memory per request, or teams without JavaScript/TypeScript expertise.
